page.title: 13New Use of Old Buildings
page.content:
THE LIBRARY is a coversion of the old Corn Exchange which was an early Victorian Stucco building.It was con- verted in 1962 by West Suffolk County Council. Now in the 121 year old building 750-1000 people visit weekly. One day in April 1985 there were 4,445 people with books on loan. THE QUAY THEATRE was the chief ware- house of the River Stour,used to store coal and grain and was even used to supply Sudbury's eletricity before becoming a theatre in 1977.It is now owned by Sudbury Dramatic Society.It has won an award for recreational/ educational projects.
by Darren Clarke and Ben Davies
